page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: BRICKYARD SOUTH SOMERCOTES by RICHARD RANCE. THE FIRST BRICKYARD IN PRODUCTION WAS IN 1855.THE CLAY PITS WAS A VERY BUSY INDUSTRY UNTIL EXACTLY 1916.A LOT OF HOUSE IN THE AREA WERE MADE BY THE CLAY THAT WAS HAND DUG BY WORKERS THAT LINED LOCALLY.THE WORKERS JOINED THE FORCES BECAUSE OF THE 1914-1918 WAR SO IT WAS FORCED TO CLOSE DOWN.AFTER 1916 IT WAS CONVERTED INTO A FARMYARD.THE OLD DRYING SHEDS AND BUILDINGS WERE USED FOR STOCK.AT SOMETIME WILD FISH WERE INTRODUCED TO THE NEW WATER FILLED PITS.FISH EGGS CARRIED BY BIRDS LEGS IS A POSSIBILITY.WATER WEED AND FISH GREW IN THE POND.AFTER 1945 ANGLERS BECAME VERY INTERESTED IN THE OLD CLAY PITS SO THEY BECAME FISHING PONDS.IN 1953 IT WAS EXTENTED BY EXCUATOR TO REPAIR THE DAMAGED SEA DEFENCES OF THE JANUARY FLOOD,SO THEY
